title: Imaginary unit
summary: The imaginary unit or unit imaginary number (i) is a solution to the quadratic equation x 2 + 1 = 0 {\displaystyle x^{2}+1=0} . Although there is no real number with this property, i can be used to extend the real numbers to what are called complex numbers, using addition and multiplication. A simple example of the use of i in a complex number is 2 + 3 i {\displaystyle 2+3i} .
